result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob W.R. Walton

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court calls @ 3:04 PM/ RM 203, 22CF146 & 22CF194. Defendant Jacob W.R. Walton not in court.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak not in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Cases were called on 10/24/22, Def. was not present in courtroom when called and warrants were issued in both cases. Def. later showed up in court. Court will vacate/quash warrants in both cases. Def. does have counsel. Court will keep bail bond forfeiture in forfeiture status, pending a bail bond forfeiture hearing and to track along. State notes complication that needs to be addressed regarding bond and State has been in touch with Def. atty. Court notes bond will need to be set. Adjourned Initial Appearance set for November 14, 2022 at 1:30 with notices being sent out to parties.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail Bond Forfeiture notice generated, however CC goes on record and tracks with AIA on November 14, 2022 so this notice not mailed to parties and destroyed.

Court calls @ 1:47 PM/ RM 203, 22CF146 & 22CF194. Defendant Jacob W.R. Walton not in court.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak in court via zoom for Jacob W.R. Walton.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. State requests warrant in each case for body only, Nationwide. Atty Babiak notes Def. was released earlier today and may not have been aware of court date. Court authorizes warrant in each case for body only, Nationwide. State moves to forfeit bond in each case. Court orders bond forfeited in each case pending a bail bond forfeiture hearing.

records.addlTxt:
3:14 PM Defendant Jacob W.R. Walton in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court notes PD counsel report. Def. continues to wish for counsel. Court questions if Def. wishes to have P.H. within time limits. Def. wishes to attain counsel before P.H. Court finds good cause to waive time limits. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:28 PM Defendant Jacob W.R. Walton in court.. Kelly L Hays in court for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. has been in contact with PD office and is still awaiting counsel. Def. still wishes to attain counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:38 PM Defendant Jacob W.R. Walton in court.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history. Def. has contacted PD office and is still awaiting counsel. Def. needs to acquire documentation that he is no longer employed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of controlled substances without a prescription.
Def. must contact Public Defender within 7 days.

3:01 PM Defendant Jacob W.R. Walton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. would like counsel. State gives bail/bond recommendation. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. Def. heard on bond.  Court gives 3 factors of setting bond & orders $2,000 cash bond with conditions  No possession of controlled substances without a prescription, Def. must contact Public Defender within 7 days.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
